param.name: AntennaTracker:FORMAT_VERSION
param.documentation: This value is incremented when changes are made to the eeprom format

param.humanName: MAVLink system ID of this vehicle
param.name: AntennaTracker:SYSID_THISMAV
param.documentation: Allows setting an individual system id for this vehicle to distinguish it from others on the same network

param.name: AntennaTracker:SYSID_MYGCS
param.documentation: The identifier of the ground station in the MAVLink protocol. Don't change this unless you also modify the ground station to match.

param.name: AntennaTracker:SYSID_TARGET
param.documentation: The identifier of the vehicle being tracked. This should be zero (to auto detect) or be the same as the SYSID_THISMAV parameter of the vehicle being tracked.

param.humanName: Time for yaw to slew through its full range
param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW_SLEW_TIME
param.documentation: This controls how rapidly the tracker will change the servo output for yaw. It is set as the number of seconds to do a full rotation. You can use this parameter to slow the trackers movements, which may help with some types of trackers. A value of zero will allow for unlimited servo movement per update.

param.humanName: Time for pitch to slew through its full range
param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH_SLEW_TIME
param.documentation: This controls how rapidly the tracker will change the servo output for pitch. It is set as the number of seconds to do a full range of pitch movement. You can use this parameter to slow the trackers movements, which may help with some types of trackers. A value of zero will allow for unlimited servo movement per update.

param.humanName: Minimum time to apply a yaw reversal
param.name: AntennaTracker:MIN_REVERSE_TIME
param.documentation: When the tracker detects it has reached the limit of servo movement in yaw it will reverse and try moving to the other extreme of yaw. This parameter controls the minimum time it should reverse for. It is used to cope with trackers that have a significant lag in movement to ensure they do move all the way around.

param.name: AntennaTracker:START_LATITUDE
param.documentation: Combined with START_LONGITUDE this parameter allows for an initial position of the tracker to be set. This position will be used until the GPS gets lock. It can also be used to run a stationary tracker with no GPS attached.

param.name: AntennaTracker:START_LONGITUDE
param.documentation: Combined with START_LATITUDE this parameter allows for an initial position of the tracker to be set. This position will be used until the GPS gets lock. It can also be used to run a stationary tracker with no GPS attached.

param.humanName: Delay before first servo movement from trim
param.name: AntennaTracker:STARTUP_DELAY
param.documentation: This parameter can be used to force the servos to their trim value for a time on startup. This can help with some servo types

param.humanName: Type of servo system being used for pitch
param.name: AntennaTracker:SERVO_PITCH_TYPE
param.documentation: This allows selection of position servos or on/off servos for pitch

param.humanName: Type of servo system being used for yaw
param.name: AntennaTracker:SERVO_YAW_TYPE
param.documentation: This allows selection of position servos or on/off servos for yaw

param.name: AntennaTracker:ONOFF_YAW_RATE
param.documentation: Rate of change of yaw in degrees/second for on/off servos

param.name: AntennaTracker:ONOFF_PITCH_RATE
param.documentation: Rate of change of pitch in degrees/second for on/off servos

param.name: AntennaTracker:ONOFF_YAW_MINT
param.documentation: Minimum amount of time in seconds to move in yaw

param.name: AntennaTracker:ONOFF_PITCH_MINT
param.documentation: Minimim amount of time in seconds to move in pitch

param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW_TRIM
param.documentation: Amount of extra yaw to add when tracking. This allows for small adjustments for an out of trim compass.

param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH_TRIM
param.documentation: Amount of extra pitch to add when tracking. This allows for small adjustments for a badly calibrated barometer.

param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW_RANGE
param.documentation: Yaw axis total range of motion in degrees

param.name: AntennaTracker:DISTANCE_MIN
param.documentation: Tracker will track targets at least this distance away

param.name: AntennaTracker:ALT_SOURCE
param.documentation: What provides altitude information for vehicle. Vehicle only assumes tracker has same altitude as vehicle's home

param.name: AntennaTracker:MAV_UPDATE_RATE
param.documentation: The rate at which Mavlink updates position and baro data

param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH_MIN
param.documentation: The lowest angle the pitch can reach

param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH_MAX
param.documentation: The highest angle the pitch can reach

param.name: AntennaTracker:LOG_BITMASK
param.documentation: 4 byte bitmap of log types to enable

param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_P
param.documentation: Pitch axis controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired pitch angle and actual pitch angle into a pitch servo pwm change

param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_I
param.documentation: Pitch axis controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired pitch angle vs actual pitch angle

param.humanName: Pitch axis controller I gain maximum
param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_IMAX
param.documentation: Pitch axis controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pwm change that the I gain will output

param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_D
param.documentation: Pitch axis controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired pitch angle vs actual pitch angle

param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_FF
param.documentation: Pitch axis controller feed forward

param.humanName: Pitch axis controller target frequency in Hz
param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_FLTT
param.documentation: Pitch axis controller target frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Pitch axis controller error frequency in Hz
param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_FLTE
param.documentation: Pitch axis controller error frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Pitch axis controller derivative frequency in Hz
param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_FLTD
param.documentation: Pitch axis controller derivative frequency in Hz

param.name: AntennaTracker:PITCH2SRV_SMAX
param.documentation: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_P
param.documentation: Yaw axis controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired yaw angle (heading) and actual yaw angle into a yaw servo pwm change

param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_I
param.documentation: Yaw axis controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired yaw angle (heading) vs actual yaw angle

param.humanName: Yaw axis controller I gain maximum
param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_IMAX
param.documentation: Yaw axis controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pwm change that the I gain will output

param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_D
param.documentation: Yaw axis controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired yaw angle (heading) vs actual yaw angle

param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_FF
param.documentation: Yaw axis controller feed forward

param.humanName: Yaw axis controller target frequency in Hz
param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_FLTT
param.documentation: Yaw axis controller target frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Yaw axis controller error frequency in Hz
param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_FLTE
param.documentation: Yaw axis controller error frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Yaw axis controller derivative frequency in Hz
param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_FLTD
param.documentation: Yaw axis controller derivative frequency in Hz

param.name: AntennaTracker:YAW2SRV_SMAX
param.documentation: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

param.name: AntennaTracker:CMD_TOTAL
param.documentation: Set to 1 if HOME location has been loaded by the ground station. Do not change this manually.

param.name: AntennaTracker:GCS_PID_MASK
param.documentation: bitmask of PIDs to send MAVLink PID_TUNING messages for

param.humanName: Speed at which to rotate the yaw axis in scan mode
param.name: AntennaTracker:SCAN_SPEED_YAW
param.documentation: This controls how rapidly the tracker will move the servos in SCAN mode

param.humanName: Speed at which to rotate pitch axis in scan mode
param.name: AntennaTracker:SCAN_SPEED_PIT
param.documentation: This controls how rapidly the tracker will move the servos in SCAN mode

param.humanName: Mode tracker will switch into after initialization
param.name: AntennaTracker:INITIAL_MODE
param.documentation: 0:MANUAL, 1:STOP, 2:SCAN, 10:AUTO

param.humanName: PWM that will be output when disarmed or in stop mode
param.name: AntennaTracker:SAFE_DISARM_PWM
param.documentation: 0:zero pwm, 1:trim pwm

param.name: AntennaTracker:AUTO_OPTIONS
param.documentation: 1: Scan for unknown target

values.value: Scan for unknown target in auto mode

param.name: AHRS_GPS_GAIN
param.documentation: This controls how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

param.humanName: AHRS use GPS for DCM navigation and position-down
param.name: AHRS_GPS_USE
param.documentation: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight. Currently this affects only the DCM-based AHRS: the EKF uses GPS according to its own parameters. A value of 2 means to use GPS for height as well as position - both in DCM estimation and when determining altitude-above-home.

values.value: Use GPS for DCM position and height

param.name: AHRS_YAW_P
param.documentation: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

param.name: AHRS_RP_P
param.documentation: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

param.name: AHRS_WIND_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is. See ARSPD_OPTIONS and ARSPD_MAX_WIND to disable airspeed sensors.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_X
param.documentation: Compensates for the roll angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle roll right.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_Y
param.documentation: Compensates for the pitch angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle pitch up/back.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_Z
param.documentation: Not Used

param.name: AHRS_ORIENTATION
param.documentation: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. The label for each option is specified in the order of rotations for that orientation. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle.

param.humanName: AHRS Velocity Complementary Filter Beta Coefficient
param.name: AHRS_COMP_BETA
param.documentation: This controls the time constant for the cross-over frequency used to fuse AHRS (airspeed and heading) and GPS data to estimate ground velocity. Time constant is 0.1/beta. A larger time constant will use GPS data less and a small time constant will use air data less.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_MINSATS
param.documentation: Minimum number of satellites visible to use GPS for velocity based corrections attitude correction. This defaults to 6, which is about the point at which the velocity numbers from a GPS become too unreliable for accurate correction of the accelerometers.

param.humanName: Use NavEKF Kalman filter for attitude and position estimation
param.name: AHRS_EKF_TYPE
param.documentation: This controls which NavEKF Kalman filter version is used for attitude and position estimation

param.name: AHRS_CUSTOM_ROLL
param.documentation: Autopilot mounting position roll offset. Positive values = roll right, negative values = roll left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: AHRS_CUSTOM_PIT
param.documentation: Autopilot mounting position pitch offset. Positive values = pitch up, negative values = pitch down. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: AHRS_CUSTOM_YAW
param.documentation: Autopilot mounting position yaw offset. Positive values = yaw right, negative values = yaw left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: ARSPD_TYPE
param.documentation: Type of airspeed sensor

param.name: ARSPD_DEVID
param.documentation: Airspeed sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: ARSPD_USE
param.documentation: Enables airspeed use for automatic throttle modes and replaces control from THR_TRIM. Continues to display and log airspeed if set to 0. Uses airspeed for control if set to 1. Only uses airspeed when throttle = 0 if set to 2 (useful for gliders with airspeed sensors behind propellers).

param.name: ARSPD_OFFSET
param.documentation: Airspeed calibration offset

param.name: ARSPD_RATIO
param.documentation: Calibrates pitot tube pressure to velocity. Increasing this value will indicate a higher airspeed at any given dynamic pressure.

param.name: ARSPD_PIN
param.documentation: The pin number that the airspeed sensor is connected to for analog sensors. Set to 15 on the Pixhawk for the analog airspeed port.

param.name: ARSPD_AUTOCAL
param.documentation: Enables automatic adjustment of ARSPD_RATIO during a calibration flight based on estimation of ground speed and true airspeed. New ratio saved every 2 minutes if change is > 5%. Should not be left enabled.

param.name: ARSPD_TUBE_ORDER
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to control whether the order in which the tubes are attached to your pitot tube matters. If you set this to 0 then the first (often the top) connector on the sensor needs to be the stagnation pressure (the pressure at the tip of the pitot tube). If set to 1 then the second (often the bottom) connector needs to be the stagnation pressure. If set to 2 (the default) then the airspeed driver will accept either order. The reason you may wish to specify the order is it will allow your airspeed sensor to detect if the aircraft is receiving excessive pressure on the static port compared to the stagnation port such as during a stall, which would otherwise be seen as a positive airspeed.

param.name: ARSPD_SKIP_CAL
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to skip airspeed offset calibration on startup, instead using the offset from the last calibration. This may be desirable if the offset variance between flights for your sensor is low and you want to avoid having to cover the pitot tube on each boot.

param.humanName: The PSI range of the device
param.name: ARSPD_PSI_RANGE
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to to set the PSI (pounds per square inch) range for your sensor. You should not change this unless you examine the datasheet for your device

param.name: ARSPD_BUS
param.documentation: Bus number of the I2C bus where the airspeed sensor is connected

param.name: ARSPD_PRIMARY
param.documentation: This selects which airspeed sensor will be the primary if multiple sensors are found

param.name: ARSPD_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Bitmask of options to use with airspeed. 0:Disable use based on airspeed/groundspeed mismatch (see ARSPD_WIND_MAX), 1:Automatically reenable use based on airspeed/groundspeed mismatch recovery (see ARSPD_WIND_MAX) 2:Disable voltage correction

param.humanName: Maximum airspeed and ground speed difference
param.name: ARSPD_WIND_MAX
param.documentation: If the difference between airspeed and ground speed is greater than this value the sensor will be marked unhealthy. Using ARSPD_OPTION this health value can be used to disable the sensor.

param.humanName: Airspeed and ground speed difference that gives a warning
param.name: ARSPD_WIND_WARN
param.documentation: If the difference between airspeed and ground speed is greater than this value the sensor will issue a warning. If 0 ARSPD_WIND_MAX is used.

param.name: ARSPD2_TYPE
param.documentation: Type of 2nd airspeed sensor

param.name: ARSPD2_USE
param.documentation: use airspeed for flight control. When set to 0 airspeed sensor can be logged and displayed on a GCS but won't be used for flight. When set to 1 it will be logged and used. When set to 2 it will be only used when the throttle is zero, which can be useful in gliders with airspeed sensors behind a propeller

param.name: ARSPD2_OFFSET
param.documentation: Airspeed calibration offset

param.name: ARSPD2_RATIO
param.documentation: Airspeed calibration ratio

param.name: ARSPD2_PIN
param.documentation: Pin number indicating location of analog airspeed sensors. Pixhawk/Cube if set to 15.

param.humanName: Automatic airspeed ratio calibration for 2nd airspeed sensor
param.name: ARSPD2_AUTOCAL
param.documentation: If this is enabled then the autopilot will automatically adjust the ARSPD_RATIO during flight, based upon an estimation filter using ground speed and true airspeed. The automatic calibration will save the new ratio to EEPROM every 2 minutes if it changes by more than 5%. This option should be enabled for a calibration flight then disabled again when calibration is complete. Leaving it enabled all the time is not recommended.

param.humanName: Control pitot tube order of 2nd airspeed sensor
param.name: ARSPD2_TUBE_ORDR
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to control whether the order in which the tubes are attached to your pitot tube matters. If you set this to 0 then the first (often the top) connector on the sensor needs to be the stagnation pressure (the pressure at the tip of the pitot tube). If set to 1 then the second (often the bottom) connector needs to be the stagnation pressure. If set to 2 (the default) then the airspeed driver will accept either order. The reason you may wish to specify the order is it will allow your airspeed sensor to detect if the aircraft is receiving excessive pressure on the static port compared to the stagnation port such as during a stall, which would otherwise be seen as a positive airspeed.

param.humanName: Skip airspeed calibration on startup for 2nd sensor
param.name: ARSPD2_SKIP_CAL
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to skip airspeed offset calibration on startup, instead using the offset from the last calibration. This may be desirable if the offset variance between flights for your sensor is low and you want to avoid having to cover the pitot tube on each boot.

param.humanName: The PSI range of the device for 2nd sensor
param.name: ARSPD2_PSI_RANGE
param.documentation: This parameter allows you to to set the PSI (pounds per square inch) range for your sensor. You should not change this unless you examine the datasheet for your device

param.name: ARSPD2_BUS
param.documentation: The bus number of the I2C bus to look for the sensor on

param.name: ARSPD2_DEVID
param.documentation: Airspeed2 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: BARO1_GND_PRESS
param.documentation: calibrated ground pressure in Pascals

param.name: BARO_GND_TEMP
param.documentation: User provided ambient ground temperature in degrees Celsius. This is used to improve the calculation of the altitude the vehicle is at. This parameter is not persistent and will be reset to 0 every time the vehicle is rebooted. A value of 0 means use the internal measurement ambient temperature.

param.name: BARO_ALT_OFFSET
param.documentation: altitude offset in meters added to barometric altitude. This is used to allow for automatic adjustment of the base barometric altitude by a ground station equipped with a barometer. The value is added to the barometric altitude read by the aircraft. It is automatically reset to 0 when the barometer is calibrated on each reboot or when a preflight calibration is performed.

param.name: BARO_PRIMARY
param.documentation: This selects which barometer will be the primary if multiple barometers are found

param.name: BARO_EXT_BUS
param.documentation: This selects the bus number for looking for an I2C barometer. When set to -1 it will probe all external i2c buses based on the GND_PROBE_EXT parameter.

param.name: BARO_SPEC_GRAV
param.documentation: This sets the specific gravity of the fluid when flying an underwater ROV.

param.name: BARO2_GND_PRESS
param.documentation: calibrated ground pressure in Pascals

param.name: BARO3_GND_PRESS
param.documentation: calibrated ground pressure in Pascals

param.humanName: Range in which sample is accepted
param.name: BARO_FLTR_RNG
param.documentation: This sets the range around the average value that new samples must be within to be accepted. This can help reduce the impact of noise on sensors that are on long I2C cables. The value is a percentage from the average value. A value of zero disables this filter.

param.name: BARO_PROBE_EXT
param.documentation: This sets which types of external i2c barometer to look for. It is a bitmask of barometer types. The I2C buses to probe is based on GND_EXT_BUS. If BARO_EXT_BUS is -1 then it will probe all external buses, otherwise it will probe just the bus number given in GND_EXT_BUS.

param.name: BARO1_DEVID
param.documentation: Barometer sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: BARO2_DEVID
param.documentation: Barometer2 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: BARO3_DEVID
param.documentation: Barometer3 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: BARO1_WCF_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables the use of wind coefficients for barometer compensation

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive X direction (forward)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_FWD
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during forwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in negative X direction (backwards)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_BCK
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during backwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive Y direction (right)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_RGT
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in negative Y direction (left)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_LFT
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.name: BARO2_WCF_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables the use of wind coefficients for barometer compensation

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive X direction (forward)
param.name: BARO2_WCF_FWD
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during forwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in negative X direction (backwards)
param.name: BARO2_WCF_BCK
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during backwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive Y direction (right)
param.name: BARO2_WCF_RGT
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in negative Y direction (left)
param.name: BARO2_WCF_LFT
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.name: BARO3_WCF_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables the use of wind coefficients for barometer compensation

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive X direction (forward)
param.name: BARO3_WCF_FWD
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during forwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in negative X direction (backwards)
param.name: BARO3_WCF_BCK
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during backwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive Y direction (right)
param.name: BARO3_WCF_RGT
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in negative Y direction (left)
param.name: BARO3_WCF_LFT
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.name: BATT2_MONITOR
param.documentation: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

param.name: BATT2_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

param.name: BATT2_SERIAL_NUM
param.documentation: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

param.name: BATT2_LOW_TIMER
param.documentation: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

param.name: BATT2_FS_VOLTSRC
param.documentation: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

param.name: BATT2_LOW_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT2_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_LOW_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_CRT_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT2_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_CRT_MAH

Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT8__ARM_VOLT parameter.

param.name: BATT8_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor
param.field: 0:Ignore DroneCAN SoC, 1:MPPT reports input voltage and current, 2:MPPT Powered off when disarmed, 3:MPPT Powered on when armed, 4:MPPT Powered off at boot, 5:MPPT Powered on at boot, 6:Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS

param.name: BATT8_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring.

param.name: BATT8_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

param.name: BATT8_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT8_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

param.name: BATT8_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17.

param.name: BATT8_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

param.name: BATT8_VLT_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset on voltage pin. This allows for an offset due to a diode. This voltage is subtracted before the scaling is applied

param.name: BATT8_I2C_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT8_I2C_ADDR
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C address

param.name: BATT8_SUM_MASK
param.documentation: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

param.name: BATT8_CURR_MULT
param.documentation: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

param.name: BATT9_MONITOR
param.documentation: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

param.name: BATT9_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

param.name: BATT9_SERIAL_NUM
param.documentation: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With DroneCan it is the battery_id.

param.name: BATT9_LOW_TIMER
param.documentation: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

param.name: BATT9_FS_VOLTSRC
param.documentation: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

param.name: BATT9_LOW_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT9_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT9_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT9_LOW_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT9_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT9_CRT_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT9_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT9_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT9_CRT_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT9__FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT9_FS_LOW_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe

param.name: BATT9_FS_CRT_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe

param.name: BATT9_ARM_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

param.name: BATT9_ARM_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT9__ARM_VOLT parameter.

param.field: 0:Ignore DroneCAN SoC, 1:MPPT reports input voltage and current, 2:MPPT Powered off when disarmed, 3:MPPT Powered on when armed, 4:MPPT Powered off at boot, 5:MPPT Powered on at boot, 6:Send resistance compensated voltage to GCS

param.documentation: 0: sum of remaining battery monitors, If none 0 sum of specified monitors. Current will be summed and voltages averaged.

param.documentation: Multiplier applied to all current related reports to allow for adjustment if no UAVCAN param access or current splitting applications

param.name: BRD_SER1_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 1 (telemetry 1). You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup. Note that the PX4v1 does not have hardware flow control pins on this port, so you should leave this disabled.

param.name: BRD_SER2_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 2 (telemetry 2). You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

param.name: BRD_SER3_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 3. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

param.name: BRD_SER4_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 4. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

param.name: BRD_SER5_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 5. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

param.humanName: Enable use of safety arming switch
param.name: BRD_SAFETYENABLE
param.documentation: This controls the default state of the safety switch at startup. When set to 1 the safety switch will start in the safe state (flashing) at boot. When set to zero the safety switch will start in the unsafe state (solid) at startup. Note that if a safety switch is fitted the user can still control the safety state after startup using the switch. The safety state can also be controlled in software using a MAVLink message.

param.name: BRD_SBUS_OUT
param.documentation: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz

param.name: BRD_SERIAL_NUM
param.documentation: User-defined serial number of this vehicle, it can be any arbitrary number you want and has no effect on the autopilot

param.humanName: Outputs which ignore the safety switch state
param.name: BRD_SAFETY_MASK
param.documentation: A bitmask which controls what outputs can move while the safety switch has not been pressed

param.name: BRD_HEAT_TARG
param.documentation: Board heater target temperature for boards with controllable heating units. DO NOT SET to -1 on the Cube. Set to -1 to disable the heater, please reboot after setting to -1.

param.name: BRD_TYPE
param.documentation: This allows selection of a PX4 or VRBRAIN board type. If set to zero then the board type is auto-detected (PX4)

param.name: BRD_IO_ENABLE
param.documentation: This allows for the IO co-processor on FMUv1 and FMUv2 to be disabled

param.name: BRD_SAFETYOPTION
param.documentation: This controls the activation of the safety button. It allows you to control if the safety button can be used for safety enable and/or disable, and whether the button is only active when disarmed
param.field: 0:ActiveForSafetyEnable,1:ActiveForSafetyDisable,2:ActiveWhenArmed,3:Force safety on when the aircraft disarms

param.name: BRD_VBUS_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum voltage on the autopilot power rail to allow the aircraft to arm. 0 to disable the check.

param.name: BRD_VSERVO_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum voltage on the servo rail to allow the aircraft to arm. 0 to disable the check.

param.name: BRD_SD_SLOWDOWN
param.documentation: This is a scaling factor to slow down microSD operation. It can be used on flight board and microSD card combinations where full speed is not reliable. For normal full speed operation a value of 0 should be used.

param.name: BRD_PWM_VOLT_SEL
param.documentation: This sets the voltage max for PWM output pulses. 0 for 3.3V and 1 for 5V output.

param.name: BRD_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Board specific option flags
param.field: 0:Enable hardware watchdog, 1:Disable MAVftp, 2:Enable set of internal parameters, 3:Enable Debug Pins, 4:Unlock flash on reboot, 5:Write protect firmware flash on reboot, 6:Write protect bootloader flash on reboot

param.name: BRD_BOOT_DELAY
param.documentation: This adds a delay in milliseconds to boot to ensure peripherals initialise fully

param.name: BRD_HEAT_P
param.documentation: Board Heater P gain

param.name: BRD_HEAT_I
param.documentation: Board Heater integrator gain

param.name: BRD_HEAT_IMAX
param.documentation: Board Heater integrator maximum

param.name: BRD_ALT_CONFIG
param.documentation: Select an alternative hardware configuration. A value of zero selects the default configuration for this board. Other values are board specific. Please see the documentation for your board for details on any alternative configuration values that may be available.

param.name: BRD_HEAT_LOWMGN
param.documentation: Arming check will fail if temp is lower than this margin below BRD_HEAT_TARG. 0 disables the low temperature check

param.humanName: Set type of direct attached radio
param.name: BRD_RADIO_TYPE
param.documentation: This enables support for direct attached radio receivers

param.name: BRD_RADIO_PROT
param.documentation: Select air protocol

param.name: BRD_RADIO_DEBUG
param.documentation: radio debug level

param.name: BRD_RADIO_DISCRC
param.documentation: disable receive CRC (for debug)

param.name: BRD_RADIO_SIGCH
param.documentation: Channel to show receive RSSI signal strength, or zero for disabled

param.name: BRD_RADIO_PPSCH
param.documentation: Channel to show received packet-per-second rate, or zero for disabled

param.name: BRD_RADIO_TELEM
param.documentation: If this is non-zero then telemetry packets will be sent over DSM

param.name: BRD_RADIO_TXPOW
param.documentation: Set telemetry transmit power. This is the power level (from 1 to 8) for telemetry packets sent from the RX to the TX

param.humanName: Put radio into FCC test mode
param.name: BRD_RADIO_FCCTST
param.documentation: If this is enabled then the radio will continuously transmit as required for FCC testing. The transmit channel is set by the value of the parameter. The radio will not work for RC input while this is enabled

param.name: BRD_RADIO_STKMD
param.documentation: This selects between different stick input modes. The default is mode2, which has throttle on the left stick and pitch on the right stick. You can instead set mode1, which has throttle on the right stick and pitch on the left stick.

param.humanName: Set radio to factory test channel
param.name: BRD_RADIO_TESTCH
param.documentation: This sets the radio to a fixed test channel for factory testing. Using a fixed channel avoids the need for binding in factory testing.

param.humanName: RSSI value channel for telemetry data on transmitter
param.name: BRD_RADIO_TSIGCH
param.documentation: Channel to show telemetry RSSI value as received by TX

param.name: BRD_RADIO_TPPSCH
param.documentation: Channel to show telemetry packets-per-second value, as received at TX

param.name: BRD_RADIO_TXMAX
param.documentation: Set transmitter maximum transmit power (from 1 to 8)

param.name: BRD_RADIO_BZOFS
param.documentation: Set transmitter buzzer note adjustment (adjust frequency up)

param.name: BRD_RADIO_ABTIME
param.documentation: When non-zero this sets the time with no transmitter packets before we start looking for auto-bind packets.

param.name: BRD_RADIO_ABLVL
param.documentation: This sets the minimum RSSI of an auto-bind packet for it to be accepted. This should be set so that auto-bind will only happen at short range to minimise the change of an auto-bind happening accidentially

param.name: BRD_RTC_TYPES
param.documentation: Specifies which sources of UTC time will be accepted

param.name: BRD_RTC_TZ_MIN
param.documentation: Adds offset in +- minutes from UTC to calculate local time

param.name: CAM_RC_TYPE
param.documentation: RunCam deviee type used to determine OSD menu structure and shutter options.

param.name: CAM_RC_FEATURES
param.documentation: The available features of the attached RunCam device. If 0 then the RunCam device will be queried for the features it supports, otherwise this setting is used.
param.field: 0:Power Button,1:WiFi Button,2:Change Mode,3:5-Key OSD,4:Settings Access,5:DisplayPort,6:Start Recording,7:Stop Recording

param.humanName: RunCam boot delay before allowing updates
param.name: CAM_RC_BT_DELAY
param.documentation: Time it takes for the RunCam to become fully ready in ms. If this is too short then commands can get out of sync.

param.humanName: RunCam button delay before allowing further button presses
param.name: CAM_RC_BTN_DELAY
param.documentation: Time it takes for the a RunCam button press to be actived in ms. If this is too short then commands can get out of sync.

param.humanName: RunCam mode delay before allowing further button presses
param.name: CAM_RC_MDE_DELAY
param.documentation: Time it takes for the a RunCam mode button press to be actived in ms. If a mode change first requires a video recording change then double this value is used. If this is too short then commands can get out of sync.

param.name: CAM_RC_CONTROL
param.documentation: Specifies the allowed actions required to enter the OSD menu
param.field: 0:Stick yaw right,1:Stick roll right,2:3-position switch,3:2-position switch,4:Autorecording enabled

param.name: CAN_LOGLEVEL
param.documentation: Loglevel for recording initialisation and debug information from CAN Interface

param.humanName: Enable use of specific protocol over virtual driver
param.name: CAN_D1_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Enabling this option starts selected protocol that will use this virtual driver

param.name: CAN_D1_KDE_NPOLE
param.documentation: Sets the number of motor poles to calculate the correct RPM value

param.name: CAN_D1_PC_ESC_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask defining which ESC (motor) channels are to be transmitted over Piccolo CAN

param.name: CAN_D1_PC_ESC_RT
param.documentation: Output rate of ESC command messages

param.name: CAN_D1_PC_SRV_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask defining which servo channels are to be transmitted over Piccolo CAN
param.field: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15, 15: Servo 16

param.name: CAN_D1_PC_SRV_RT
param.documentation: Output rate of servo command messages

param.name: CAN_D1_TST_ID
param.documentation: Selects the Index of Test that needs to be run recursively, this value gets reset to 0 at boot.

param.name: CAN_D1_TST_LPR8
param.documentation: Selects the Looprate of Test methods

param.humanName: UAVCAN node that is used for this network
param.name: CAN_D1_UC_NODE
param.documentation: UAVCAN node should be set implicitly

param.humanName: RC Out channels to be transmitted as servo over UAVCAN
param.name: CAN_D1_UC_SRV_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a servo command over UAVCAN
param.field: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15

param.humanName: RC Out channels to be transmitted as ESC over UAVCAN
param.name: CAN_D1_UC_ESC_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a ESC command over UAVCAN

param.name: CAN_D1_UC_SRV_RT
param.documentation: Maximum transmit rate for servo outputs

param.name: CAN_D1_UC_OPTION
param.documentation: Option flags

param.name: CAN_D1_UC_NTF_RT
param.documentation: Maximum transmit rate for Notify State Message

param.humanName: Enable use of specific protocol over virtual driver
param.name: CAN_D2_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Enabling this option starts selected protocol that will use this virtual driver

param.documentation: Maximum transmit rate for Notify State Message

param.humanName: Index of virtual driver to be used with physical CAN interface

param.documentation: Bit rate can be set up to from 10000 to 1000000

param.name: CAN_P1_FDBITRATE
param.documentation: Bit rate can be set up to from 1000000 to 8000000

param.name: CAN_P3_BITRATE

param.name: CAN_P3_FDBITRATE

param.name: CAN_SLCAN_CPORT
param.documentation: CAN Interface ID to be routed to SLCAN, 0 means no routing

param.name: CAN_SLCAN_SERNUM
param.documentation: Serial Port ID to be used for temporary SLCAN iface, -1 means no temporary serial. This parameter is automatically reset on reboot or on timeout. See CAN_SLCAN_TIMOUT for timeout details

param.name: CAN_SLCAN_TIMOUT
param.documentation: Duration of inactivity after which SLCAN is switched back to original driver in seconds.

param.name: CAN_SLCAN_SDELAY
param.documentation: Duration after which slcan starts after setting SERNUM in seconds.

param.humanName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the X axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_X
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_Y
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_Z
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.name: COMPASS_DEC
param.documentation: An angle to compensate between the true north and magnetic north

param.name: COMPASS_LEARN
param.documentation: Enable or disable the automatic learning of compass offsets. You can enable learning either using a compass-only method that is suitable only for fixed wing aircraft or using the offsets learnt by the active EKF state estimator. If this option is enabled then the learnt offsets are saved when you disarm the vehicle. If InFlight learning is enabled then the compass with automatically start learning once a flight starts (must be armed). While InFlight learning is running you cannot use position control modes.

param.name: COMPASS_USE
param.documentation: Enable or disable the use of the compass (instead of the GPS) for determining heading

param.name: COMPASS_AUTODEC
param.documentation: Enable or disable the automatic calculation of the declination based on gps location

param.name: COMPASS_MOTCT
param.documentation: Set motor interference compensation type to disabled, throttle or current. Do not change manually.

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame X axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_X
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_Y
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_Z
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.name: COMPASS_ORIENT
param.documentation: The orientation of the first external compass relative to the vehicle frame. This value will be ignored unless this compass is set as an external compass. When set correctly in the northern hemisphere, pointing the nose and right side down should increase the MagX and MagY values respectively. Rolling the vehicle upside down should decrease the MagZ value. For southern hemisphere, switch increase and decrease. NOTE: For internal compasses, AHRS_ORIENT is used. The label for each option is specified in the order of rotations for that orientation.

param.humanName: Compass is attached via an external cable
param.name: COMPASS_EXTERNAL
param.documentation: Configure compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on most boards. Set to 1 if the compass is externally connected. When externally connected the COMPASS_ORIENT option operates independently of the AHRS_ORIENTATION board orientation option. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

param.humanName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the X axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS2_X
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass2's x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS2_Y
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass2's y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS2_Z
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass2's z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame X axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT2_X
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT2_Y
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT2_Z
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Compass3 offsets in milligauss on the X axis

param.humanName: Compass3 offsets in milligauss on the Y axis

param.humanName: Compass3 offsets in milligauss on the Z axis

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass3 for body frame X axis

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID
param.documentation: Compass device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.documentation: Second compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID3
param.documentation: Third compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_USE2
param.documentation: Enable or disable the secondary compass for determining heading.

param.name: COMPASS_ORIENT2
param.documentation: The orientation of a second external compass relative to the vehicle frame. This value will be ignored unless this compass is set as an external compass. When set correctly in the northern hemisphere, pointing the nose and right side down should increase the MagX and MagY values respectively. Rolling the vehicle upside down should decrease the MagZ value. For southern hemisphere, switch increase and decrease. NOTE: For internal compasses, AHRS_ORIENT is used.

param.name: COMPASS_USE3
param.documentation: Enable or disable the tertiary compass for determining heading.

param.name: COMPASS_ORIENT3
param.documentation: The orientation of a third external compass relative to the vehicle frame. This value will be ignored unless this compass is set as an external compass. When set correctly in the northern hemisphere, pointing the nose and right side down should increase the MagX and MagY values respectively. Rolling the vehicle upside down should decrease the MagZ value. For southern hemisphere, switch increase and decrease. NOTE: For internal compasses, AHRS_ORIENT is used.

param.humanName: Compass3 is attached via an external cable

param.documentation: Configure third compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on most boards. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

param.name: COMPASS_CAL_FIT
param.documentation: This controls the fitness level required for a successful compass calibration. A lower value makes for a stricter fit (less likely to pass). This is the value used for the primary magnetometer. Other magnetometers get double the value.

param.name: COMPASS_OFFS_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum allowed compass offset in calibration and arming checks

param.name: COMPASS_TYPEMASK
param.documentation: This is a bitmask of driver types to disable. If a driver type is set in this mask then that driver will not try to find a sensor at startup

param.humanName: Range in which sample is accepted
param.name: COMPASS_FLTR_RNG
param.documentation: This sets the range around the average value that new samples must be within to be accepted. This can help reduce the impact of noise on sensors that are on long I2C cables. The value is a percentage from the average value. A value of zero disables this filter.

param.name: COMPASS_AUTO_ROT
param.documentation: When enabled this will automatically check the orientation of compasses on successful completion of compass calibration. If set to 2 then external compasses will have their orientation automatically corrected.

values.value: use same tolerance to auto rotate 45 deg rotations

param.humanName: Compass device id with 1st order priority
param.name: COMPASS_PRIO1_ID
param.documentation: Compass device id with 1st order priority, set automatically if 0. Reboot required after change.

param.humanName: Compass device id with 2nd order priority
param.name: COMPASS_PRIO2_ID
param.documentation: Compass device id with 2nd order priority, set automatically if 0. Reboot required after change.

param.humanName: Compass device id with 3rd order priority
param.name: COMPASS_PRIO3_ID
param.documentation: Compass device id with 3rd order priority, set automatically if 0. Reboot required after change.

param.name: COMPASS_ENABLE
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the compass. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the compass. Note that this is separate from COMPASS_USE. This will enable the low level senor, and will enable logging of magnetometer data. To use the compass for navigation you must also set COMPASS_USE to 1.

param.name: COMPASS_SCALE
param.documentation: Scaling factor for first compass to compensate for sensor scaling errors. If this is 0 then no scaling is done

param.name: COMPASS_SCALE2
param.documentation: Scaling factor for 2nd compass to compensate for sensor scaling errors. If this is 0 then no scaling is done

param.name: COMPASS_SCALE3
param.documentation: Scaling factor for 3rd compass to compensate for sensor scaling errors. If this is 0 then no scaling is done

param.name: COMPASS_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This sets options to change the behaviour of the compass

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID4
param.documentation: Extra 4th compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID5
param.documentation: Extra 5th compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID6
param.documentation: Extra 6th compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID7
param.documentation: Extra 7th compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_DEV_ID8
param.documentation: Extra 8th compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_CUS_ROLL
param.documentation: Compass mounting position roll offset. Positive values = roll right, negative values = roll left. This parameter is only used when COMPASS_ORIENT/2/3 is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: COMPASS_CUS_PIT
param.documentation: Compass mounting position pitch offset. Positive values = pitch up, negative values = pitch down. This parameter is only used when COMPASS_ORIENT/2/3 is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: COMPASS_CUS_YAW
param.documentation: Compass mounting position yaw offset. Positive values = yaw right, negative values = yaw left. This parameter is only used when COMPASS_ORIENT/2/3 is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT_EN
param.documentation: This enables per-motor compass corrections

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT_EXP
param.documentation: This is the exponential correction for the power output of the motor for per-motor compass correction

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT1_X
param.documentation: Compensation for X axis of motor1

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT1_Y
param.documentation: Compensation for Y axis of motor1

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT1_Z
param.documentation: Compensation for Z axis of motor1

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT2_X
param.documentation: Compensation for X axis of motor2

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT2_Y
param.documentation: Compensation for Y axis of motor2

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT2_Z
param.documentation: Compensation for Z axis of motor2

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT3_X
param.documentation: Compensation for X axis of motor3

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT3_Y
param.documentation: Compensation for Y axis of motor3

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT3_Z
param.documentation: Compensation for Z axis of motor3

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT4_X
param.documentation: Compensation for X axis of motor4

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT4_Y
param.documentation: Compensation for Y axis of motor4

param.name: COMPASS_PMOT4_Z
param.documentation: Compensation for Z axis of motor4

param.name: CUST_ROT_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables custom rotations

param.name: CUST_ROT1_ROLL
param.documentation: Custom euler roll, euler 321 (yaw, pitch, roll) ordering

param.name: CUST_ROT1_PITCH
param.documentation: Custom euler pitch, euler 321 (yaw, pitch, roll) ordering

param.name: CUST_ROT1_YAW
param.documentation: Custom euler yaw, euler 321 (yaw, pitch, roll) ordering

param.name: CUST_ROT2_ROLL
param.documentation: Custom euler roll, euler 321 (yaw, pitch, roll) ordering

param.name: CUST_ROT2_PITCH
param.documentation: Custom euler pitch, euler 321 (yaw, pitch, roll) ordering

param.name: CUST_ROT2_YAW
param.documentation: Custom euler yaw, euler 321 (yaw, pitch, roll) ordering

param.name: EAHRS_TYPE
param.documentation: Type of AHRS device

param.name: EAHRS_RATE
param.documentation: Requested rate for AHRS device

param.name: EFI_TYPE
param.documentation: What method of communication is used for EFI #1

param.name: EFI_COEF1
param.documentation: Used to calibrate fuel flow for MS protocol (Slope)

param.name: EFI_COEF2
param.documentation: Used to calibrate fuel flow for MS protocol (Offset)

param.name: FFT_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable Gyro FFT analyser

param.name: FFT_MINHZ
param.documentation: Lower bound of FFT frequency detection in Hz. On larger vehicles the minimum motor frequency is likely to be significantly lower than for smaller vehicles.

param.name: FFT_MAXHZ
param.documentation: Upper bound of FFT frequency detection in Hz. On smaller vehicles the maximum motor frequency is likely to be significantly higher than for larger vehicles.

param.name: FFT_SAMPLE_MODE
param.documentation: Sampling mode (and therefore rate). 0: Gyro rate sampling, 1: Fast loop rate sampling, 2: Fast loop rate / 2 sampling, 3: Fast loop rate / 3 sampling. Takes effect on reboot.

param.name: FFT_WINDOW_SIZE
param.documentation: Size of window to be used in FFT calculations. Takes effect on reboot. Must be a power of 2 and between 32 and 512. Larger windows give greater frequency resolution but poorer time resolution, consume more CPU time and may not be appropriate for all vehicles. Time and frequency resolution are given by the sample-rate / window-size. Windows of 256 are only really recommended for F7 class boards, windows of 512 or more H7 class.

param.name: FFT_WINDOW_OLAP
param.documentation: Percentage of window to be overlapped before another frame is process. Takes effect on reboot. A good default is 50% overlap. Higher overlap results in more processed frames but not necessarily more temporal resolution. Lower overlap results in lost information at the frame edges.

param.name: FFT_FREQ_HOVER
param.documentation: The learned hover noise frequency

param.name: FFT_THR_REF
param.documentation: FFT learned thrust reference for the hover frequency and FFT minimum frequency.

param.name: FFT_SNR_REF
param.documentation: FFT SNR reference threshold in dB at which a signal is determined to be present.

param.name: FFT_ATT_REF
param.documentation: FFT attenuation level in dB for bandwidth calculation and peak detection. The bandwidth is calculated by comparing peak power output with the attenuated version. The default of 15 has shown to be a good compromise in both simulations and real flight.

param.name: FFT_BW_HOVER
param.documentation: FFT learned bandwidth at hover for the attenuation frequencies.

param.name: FFT_HMNC_FIT
param.documentation: FFT harmonic fit frequency threshold percentage at which a signal of the appropriate frequency is determined to be the harmonic of another. Signals that have a harmonic relationship that varies at most by this percentage are considered harmonics of each other for the purpose of selecting the harmonic notch frequency. If a match is found then the lower frequency harmonic is always used as the basis for the dynamic harmonic notch. A value of zero completely disables harmonic matching.

param.name: FFT_HMNC_PEAK
param.documentation: The FFT harmonic peak target that should be returned by FTN1.PkAvg. The resulting value will be used by the harmonic notch if configured to track the FFT frequency. By default the appropriate peak is auto-detected based on the harmonic fit between peaks and the energy-weighted average frequency on roll on pitch is used. Setting this to 1 will always target the highest energy peak. Setting this to 2 will target the highest energy peak that is lower in frequency than the highest energy peak. Setting this to 3 will target the highest energy peak that is higher in frequency than the highest energy peak. Setting this to 4 will target the highest energy peak on the roll axis only and only the roll frequency will be used (some vehicles have a much more pronounced peak on roll). Setting this to 5 will target the highest energy peak on the pitch axis only and only the pitch frequency will be used (some vehicles have a much more pronounced peak on roll).

param.name: FRSKY_UPLINK_ID
param.documentation: Change the uplink sensor id (SPort only)

param.name: FRSKY_DNLINK1_ID
param.documentation: Change the first extra downlink sensor id (SPort only)

param.name: FRSKY_DNLINK2_ID
param.documentation: Change the second extra downlink sensor id (SPort only)

param.name: FRSKY_DNLINK_ID
param.documentation: Change the default downlink sensor id (SPort only)

param.name: FRSKY_OPTIONS
param.documentation: A bitmask to set some FRSky Telemetry specific options

param.name: GEN_TYPE
param.documentation: Generator type

param.name: GPS_TYPE
param.documentation: GPS type of 1st GPS

param.name: GPS_TYPE2
param.documentation: GPS type of 2nd GPS

param.name: GPS_NAVFILTER
param.documentation: Navigation filter engine setting

param.name: GPS_AUTO_SWITCH
param.documentation: Automatic switchover to GPS reporting best lock, 1:UseBest selects the GPS with highest status, if both are equal the GPS with highest satellite count is used 4:Use primary if 3D fix or better, will revert to 'UseBest' behaviour if 3D fix is lost on primary

values.value: Use primary if 3D fix or better

param.humanName: Minimum Lock Type Accepted for DGPS
param.name: GPS_MIN_DGPS
param.documentation: Sets the minimum type of differential GPS corrections required before allowing to switch into DGPS mode.

param.name: GPS_SBAS_MODE
param.documentation: This sets the SBAS (satellite based augmentation system) mode if available on this GPS. If set to 2 then the SBAS mode is not changed in the GPS. Otherwise the GPS will be reconfigured to enable/disable SBAS. Disabling SBAS may be worthwhile in some parts of the world where an SBAS signal is available but the baseline is too long to be useful.

param.name: GPS_MIN_ELEV
param.documentation: This sets the minimum elevation of satellites above the horizon for them to be used for navigation. Setting this to -100 leaves the minimum elevation set to the GPS modules default.

param.name: GPS_INJECT_TO
param.documentation: The GGS can send raw serial packets to inject data to multiple GPSes.

param.name: GPS_SBP_LOGMASK
param.documentation: Masked with the SBP msg_type field to determine whether SBR1/SBR2 data is logged

param.name: GPS_RAW_DATA
param.documentation: Handles logging raw data; on uBlox chips that support raw data this will log RXM messages into logger; on Septentrio this will log on the equipment's SD card and when set to 2, the autopilot will try to stop logging after disarming and restart after arming

values.value: Only log every five samples (uBlox only)

param.name: GPS_GNSS_MODE
param.documentation: Bitmask for what GNSS system to use on the first GPS (all unchecked or zero to leave GPS as configured)

param.name: GPS_SAVE_CFG
param.documentation: Determines whether the configuration for this GPS should be written to non-volatile memory on the GPS. Currently working for UBlox 6 series and above.

param.name: GPS_GNSS_MODE2
param.documentation: Bitmask for what GNSS system to use on the second GPS (all unchecked or zero to leave GPS as configured)

param.name: GPS_AUTO_CONFIG
param.documentation: Controls if the autopilot should automatically configure the GPS based on the parameters and default settings

values.value: Enable automatic configuration for Serial GPSes only
Enable automatic configuration for DroneCAN as well

param.name: GPS_RATE_MS
param.documentation: Controls how often the GPS should provide a position update. Lowering below 5Hz(default) is not allowed. Raising the rate above 5Hz usually provides little benefit and for some GPS (eg Ublox M9N) can severely impact performance.

param.name: GPS_RATE_MS2
param.documentation: Controls how often the GPS should provide a position update. Lowering below 5Hz(default) is not allowed. Raising the rate above 5Hz usually provides little benefit and for some GPS (eg Ublox M9N) can severely impact performance.

param.name: GPS_POS1_X
param.documentation: X position of the first GPS antenna in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

param.name: GPS_POS1_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the first GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

param.name: GPS_POS1_Z
param.documentation: Z position of the first GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

param.name: GPS_POS2_X
param.documentation: X position of the second GPS antenna in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

param.name: GPS_POS2_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the second GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

param.name: GPS_POS2_Z
param.documentation: Z position of the second GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

param.name: GPS_DELAY_MS
param.documentation: Controls the amount of GPS measurement delay that the autopilot compensates for. Set to zero to use the default delay for the detected GPS type.

param.name: GPS_DELAY_MS2
param.documentation: Controls the amount of GPS measurement delay that the autopilot compensates for. Set to zero to use the default delay for the detected GPS type.

param.name: GPS_BLEND_MASK
param.documentation: Determines which of the accuracy measures Horizontal position, Vertical Position and Speed are used to calculate the weighting on each GPS receiver when soft switching has been selected by setting GPS_AUTO_SWITCH to 2(Blend)

param.name: GPS_BLEND_TC
param.documentation: Controls the slowest time constant applied to the calculation of GPS position and height offsets used to adjust different GPS receivers for steady state position differences.

param.name: GPS_DRV_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Additional backend specific options
param.field: 0:Use UART2 for moving baseline on ublox,1:Use base station for GPS yaw on SBF,2:Use baudrate 115200,3:Use dedicated CAN port b/w GPSes for moving baseline

param.name: GPS_COM_PORT
param.documentation: The physical COM port on the connected device, currently only applies to SBF GPS

param.name: GPS_COM_PORT2
param.documentation: The physical COM port on the connected device, currently only applies to SBF GPS

param.name: GPS_PRIMARY
param.documentation: This GPS will be used when GPS_AUTO_SWITCH is 0 and used preferentially with GPS_AUTO_SWITCH = 4.

param.name: GPS_CAN_NODEID1
param.documentation: GPS Node id for first-discovered GPS.

param.name: GPS_CAN_NODEID2
param.documentation: GPS Node id for second-discovered GPS.

param.name: GPS1_CAN_OVRIDE
param.documentation: GPS Node id for first GPS. If 0 the gps will be automatically selected on a first-come-first-GPS basis.

param.name: GPS2_CAN_OVRIDE
param.documentation: GPS Node id for second GPS. If 0 the gps will be automatically selected on a second-come-second-GPS basis.

param.name: GPS_MB1_TYPE

param.name: GPS_MB1_OFS_X

param.name: INS_GYRO_FILTER
param.documentation: Filter cutoff frequency for gyroscopes. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. A value of zero means no filtering (not recommended!)

param.name: INS_ACCEL_FILTER
param.documentation: Filter cutoff frequency for accelerometers. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. A value of zero means no filtering (not recommended!)

param.humanName: Use first IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
param.name: INS_USE
param.documentation: Use first IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

param.humanName: Use second IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
param.name: INS_USE2
param.documentation: Use second IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

param.name: INS_USE3
param.documentation: Use third IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

param.humanName: Stillness threshold for detecting if we are moving
param.name: INS_STILL_THRESH
param.documentation: Threshold to tolerate vibration to determine if vehicle is motionless. This depends on the frame type and if there is a constant vibration due to motors before launch or after landing. Total motionless is about 0.05. Suggested values: Planes/rover use 0.1, multirotors use 1, tradHeli uses 5

param.name: INS_GYR_CAL
param.documentation: Conrols when automatic gyro calibration is performed

param.name: INS_TRIM_OPTION
param.documentation: Specifies how the accel cal routine determines the trims

values.value: Assume ACC_BODYFIX is perfectly aligned to the vehicle

param.name: INS_ACC_BODYFIX
param.documentation: The body-fixed accelerometer to be used for trim calculation

param.name: INS_POS1_X
param.documentation: X position of the first IMU Accelerometer in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

param.documentation: Y position of the first IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

param.name: INS_GYR_ID
param.documentation: Gyro sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.documentation: Accelerometer sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: INS_ACC3_ID
